result.execSummary:
The defendant David A. Gillingham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With work release/huber.  Sentence to begin immediately.
Defendant to write a sincere letter of apology to the victim and give that letter to the Victim Witness Coordinator for her review and Court's approval.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: (4th page was filed as is - partially faded)

Defendant David A. Gillingham in court with attorney Peter A. Bartelt. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CM231, 15CM230, 16CM24, and 16CM59 called together.  Parties inform the Court that they've reached an agreement for resolution calling for def's pleas to count 1/bail jumping in 15CM231 and count 1/bail jumping in 16CM24 for dismissal/read in of other counts/cases.  Def pleads no contest to those two counts.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  

Sentence:

15CM231:  9 months jail with 71 days credit and order that def write an apology letter to the victim, letter to be reviewed by VW Coordinator.  Court orders def to write sincere, meaningful apology letter.  Costs.
16CM24:  3 months jail, consecutive to 15CM231.  Costs remitted.

Def's requested jail stay denied by the Court.

Work release/huber.

Remaining counts/cases dismissed/read in.
Status conference on June 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Peter A. Bartelt appeared by phone means for the Defendant.  Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel jointly request adjournment.  Court sets 6/1 at 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.
posted electronically through the Richland County Sheriff's Department's GovPay service

Bail/Review hearing -  Cases 15CM230 and 15CM231 called together.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt appeared by phone means for Defendant David A. Gillingham who is appearing via video. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Victim SD had asked for the no contact be dropped from bail bond in 15CM230.  Court questions victim.  Atty AF states issues.  Atty PB states def. would like to get his property, and scheduling a time to do so would be ok.  Court will permit a time for DG to get his belongings on 2 occasions.  Court will permit contact while DG is still in jail, and they can schedule the 2 days for DG to get his belongings.  The times will be reported to the clerk's office prior to the days, and they will report this to the sheriff's dept.  The court adds that these scheduled times will need to be between the hours of 6AM and 10PM.

ADDRESS INFO for David A. Gillingham
Current: 17811 Old County Farm Dr., Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 01-07-2016)
Prior: 17811 Old County Farm Drive, Richland Center, WI 53581

AMENDED - to $250 cash instead of $500.  Defendant is not to enter into any bars/taverns or establishment where the sale of alcohol is the primary business. Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol.  
	Must submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance.

Bail/Bond Review at 01-08-2016 02:00 pm.
Status conference at 03-02-2016 02:30 pm.

Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Defendant David A. Gillingham. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant David A. Gillingham appeared by video means.  15CM230 and 231 called together.  Bond in 231 amended to $250 cash with conditions of no possess/consume alcohol, test on demand, and no taverns; also no contact with SD.  DA notes receipt of request from SD for removal of the no contact condition; State objects to that request; asks for hearing to be set on SD's request.  Court resets these matters for 3/2 at 2:30 - status.  NG pleas entered today in both matters.  Bail hrg/review 1/8 at 2 to address SD's request.  Bail/Bond Review scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Peter A. Bartelt by telephone for Defendant David A. Gillingham. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant David A. Gillingham appeared in person, in custody.  DA asks that both 15CM230 and 15CM231 be called for initial appearance today as both complaints have been filed (initial in 15CM130 was set for 1/5).  No objection from Atty. B for both matters to be called.  Court states the charges and informs def of possible max. penalties. Pleas not yet taken.  Matters adjourned to Jan. 6th at 2:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
